verse.roman:
kumbhāṇḍa-kūpakarṇaś ca
petatur muṣalārditau
dudruvus tad-anīkani
hata-nāthāni sarvataḥ

synonyms: kumbhāṇḍa-kūpakarṇaḥ ca—Kumbhāṇḍa and Kūpakarṇa; petatuḥ—fell; muṣala—by the club (of Lord Balarāma); arditau—distressed; dudruvuḥ—fled; tat—their; anīkāni—armies; hata—killed; sarvataḥ—in all directions.
translation: Kumbhāṇḍa and Kūpakarṇa, tormented by Lord Balarāma's club, fell down dead. When the soldiers of these two demons saw that their leaders had been killed, they scattered in all directions.
